name: shallow
content:
shallow adjective
(NOT DEEP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 having only a short distance from the top to the bottom: The stream was fairly shallow so we were able to walk across it. She told her children to stay in the shallow end (of the swimming pool). Fry the onions in a shallow pan. These beech trees have shallow roots (= roots which do not go very deep into the ground). Opposite
deep (TOP TO BOTTOM)

consisting of very few people or things: We are dealing with a very shallow pool of candidates.
